circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Decedent found in woods beside a Lowes Home Improvement store.  No drugs or signs of foul play noted by the Monroe Police Department.  A permanent resident card was found with the body with this name and date of birth, however, fingerprint search indicated that this individual had at least 8 alias and 6 date of births, putting age from 40 to 61 years.  DNA samples collected and will be sent to the NC Crime Lab to create a profile and hopefully entry into CODIS to possibly match up against someone that could be related to this individual.

circumstances.circumstancesOfRecovery: Found deceased during welfare check by law enforcement.

On April 12,1360 employees of the State Highway Commission found a human skeleton in a patch of woods just off U.S. Highway 264 and a dirt, road. The Beaufort County Sheriff's Office responded, and the bones were collected which consisted of a skull and numerous other bones, along with the remnants of a print dress and a piece of canvass tarpaulin. On April 13,1960 a Deputy Sheriff and SBI Agents transported these remains to the Anthropology Department at UNC-CH.

On June 28,1960 information was received by the Beaufort County Sheriff’s Office to the effect that Ruth Allen, black female, 35, was missing from Wilson North Carolina 

On June 29 ,1960 an SBI Agent in company with  a Deputy Sheriff,  went to Raleigh and obtained the dress, which the victim was wearing, and the tarpaulin and returned to the Wilson County Sheriff’s Office where family members and friends positively identified the dress as belonging to Ruth Allen.  

A suspect was arrested in this case in July 1959 and had hung himself in the Wilson County jail just 13 hours after being arrested. The remains of a human one skeleton mile had been found approximately one mile west of the town of Pantego North Carolina about 100 yards off US 264 and about 60 feet from the road, which lead to Dewey Topping.
In-patient death at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center.
In-patient hospital death. Next of kin wished for her to go unclaimed.
